problem_summary_simple: Find the largest positive number in an array that also has its negative counterpart present.
problem_summary_technical: Utilize a hash set to store array elements for O(1) average time lookups to find the largest k where both k and -k exist.
key_insights: A hash set provides efficient O(1) average time complexity for checking the existence of elements.
Iterating through positive numbers and checking for their negatives in the set is a direct approach.
The `or [-1]` handles the case where no such pair exists.
